24 Hour Residential Care

Beecholme Adult Care operates a 24-hour residential care home in a quiet area of Mitcham surrounded by a beautiful and charming English & Japanese Garden.

Beecholme offers a caring and friendly environment with lovely, homely rooms, a comfortable lounge area where residents can relax, socialise or watch television, a fully equipped kitchen where our staff cook fresh meals and tasty baking and a bright dining room which looks out onto the picturesque garden which is widely used in the summer months.

Beecholme Features

Comfortable & Personal Experience

BAC Supported Living Accommodation welcomes maximum of 13 service users between the ages of 18 and 65.

24-Hour Care

Professional support workers are staffed 24 hours to assist each service user with daily needs.

Safe & Secure Environment

The residential care home provides a Safe environment. Regularly inspected to comply with the high standards set by the Care Quality Commission.

12-Week Recovery Programme

Customised 12-week recovery program that gradually prepares services users recovering from mental health disabilities to achieve their independent goals.

Independent Living

A professional care approach that fosters and enables independent lifestyles for seamless reintegration.

Continued Rehabilitation

Support from psychiatric hospitals, medium secure units and other multi agency settings help Beecholme Adult Care to provide high quality and person-centred recovery for service users struggling with mental health.

Customised Care

BAC supported living services provide professional care packages and staffing to suit each service userÂ´s needs.

Training & Educational Programmes

service users are encouraged to attend group or individual programmes to regain lost abilities or develop new skills.

Equality & Responsbility

Respecting the human rights of each service user, ensuring privacy, dignity and the responsibility of choice is a core of BAC supported living services.

Multi-Agency Partnerships

To ensure the highest quality of care, Beecholme Adult Care work in close relationship with other agencies and health care practitioners.

Make a referral

Community

Socialisation with others is essential in learning how to interact and is one of the first steps towards becoming independent, reinforcing personal recovery and reconnection with the community.

Close to BAC residential care home, service users can find a wealth of cultural activities and entertainment including the Mitcham town centre with local cafes, shops and supermarkets only a 10 minute walk away.

Within the local community you can find:

  • Local Library
  • Indoor & Outdoor Gyms
  • National Trust Parks
  • Swimming Pools
  • Ice Skating Rinks
  • Theatres & Museums
  • Cinemas
  • Local Colleges
  • Education & Job Centres
  • Places of Worship
  • Community & Health Centres
  • Mitcham Eastfields & Mitcham Junction

    • Dining at Beecholme

    Meals at our care home are prepared on site using high quality ingredients low in fat and offer a balance between protein, vegetables, fruit and carbohydrates, giving service users a healthy and nutritiously-balance diet.

    Our support workers also prepare special meals for residents who have specific dietary requirements and as a part of their rehabilitation program.

    At Beecholme Adult Care service users have the opportunity to participate in the preparation of meals and in addition to self-prepared meals, they have the alternative choice to order from local restaurants.

    Within a 3km radius, a selection of meal options can be found such as:

  • Chinese
  • Pizza
  • Kebab
  • Indian
  • English
  • Burgers
  • Caribbean
